DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether young child receive Vitamin A Zinc supplement low incidence symptomatic malaria similar child receive vitamin A supplement alone .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Vitamin A Zinc Supplementation Malarial Morbidity
DOC.detailed_description: The aim study determine impact combination vitamin A zinc supplement malaria morbidity young child . The primary objective determine effect vitamin A alone vs. vitamin A zinc supplement incidence clinical malaria . The specific objective determine effect vitamin A alone vs. vitamin A zinc supplement change anthropometric measurement specifically weight length/height ass effect study intervention incidence anemia , diarrhea pneumonia . It also assess tolerability supplement determine change zinc status measure plasma zinc concentration use atomic absorption spectrometry end intervention . The study also determine change vitamin A status assess modify relative dose response ( MRDR ) test end intervention .
DOC.criteria: Children age 6 24 month Child 's guardian willing provide inform consent Child 's family plan remain resident study area study period Clinical evidence vitamin A deficiency Severe acute malnutrition Severe illness Child age < 6 month > 24 month Receipt vitamin A supplement within last three month
